required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Differences in Ovarian Aging Between Caucasian and Indian Women
clinical_study.official_title: Ethnicity as a Determinant of Ovarian Aging: Differences Between Caucasian and Indian Women

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators want to carry out a prospective study of 400 infertile Caucasian and Indian women who will undergo a controlled ovarian stimulation for in vitro fertilization (IVF). The investigators will collect data about ovarian reserve markers and also the results after ovarian stimulation in both ethnic groups.The aim is to identify differences in ovarian response after IVF stimulation between both groups.

detailed_description.textblock:
A total of 200 Caucasian patients and 200 Indian patients who will attend the first or second IVF cycle will be included.
The date we will collect in both groups include the age, the body mass index, and the ovarian reserve markers like the antral follicle count (AFC), the follicle stimulation hormone (FSH) and antimullerian hormone (AMH) serum levels.
The investigators will also determine the number of oocytes retrieved and the metaphase two oocytes in both groups after IVF stimulation.

primary_outcome.measure: AMH levels produced by granulosa cells
primary_outcome.description: AMH levels (ng/mL) as well as AFC in both ethnic groups.

secondary_outcome.description: The number of oocytes retrieved as well as the mature oocytes after IVF ovarian stimulation

clinical_study.condition: Age of the Patients and the Body Mass Index in Both Groups

arm_group.description: 200 Caucasian infertile women undergoing their first or second IVF cycle
200 Indian women undergoing their first or second IVF cycle.

study_pop.textblock: Caucasian infertile women and Indican infertile women age < 42 years old, with both ovaries present, undergoing an IVF treatment due to male factor, tubal disease or previous failed IUI.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Women aged < 42 years old, with both ovaries present, undergoing a first or second IVF treatment due to male factor, tubal disease or previous failed intrauterine insemination (IUI).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Women diagnosed of polycystic ovary syndrome according to Rotterdam criteria, endometriosis stage III-IV, or previous pelvic inflammatory disease.
